reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Development Cooperation Programme of the Siemenpuu-Kansalaisliikkeiden yhteistyosaatio sr Foundation 2018-2021

description.narrative: The programme of the Siemenpuu-Kansalaisliikkeiden yhteistyosaatio sr Foundation in 2018-2021 is a continuation of the activities that Siemenpuu-Kansalaisliikkeiden yhteistyosaatio sr has carried out since 2002 as a funder of environmental and democracy in itiatives of civil society organisations in the global south and as a communicator of development issues in Finland. Siemenpuu-Kansalaisliikkeiden yhteistyosaatio sr?s activities contribute to the realization of Finland?s development policy goals. The proj ects supported by Siemenpuu-Kansalaisliikkeiden yhteistyosaatio sr in developing countries alleviate poverty and inequality and decrease biodiversity loss and climate emissions. The projects are initiated planned and implemented by local civil society orga nizations (CSOs) in the South. During 2018-2021 Siemenpuu-Kansalaisliikkeiden yhteistyosaatio sr will call for proposals through five funding schemes: - A Just Transition to Ecological Democracy- Forests and Coastal Ecosystems- Biocultural Rights of Indige nous Forest Communities- Rural Women and Food Sovereignty- Climate and Energy JusticeThe support for the strengthening of civil societies is a cross-cutting goal of the programme. Human rights based approach improving women?s rights and position as well as mitigation of and adaptation to climate change are also included in all five funding schemes. During 2018-2021 projects will be funded in South and Southeast Asia Africa Middle East and Latin America. The main focus countries are Brazil Indonesia India Ma li Myanmar and Nepal as in all these countries Siemenpuu-Kansalaisliikkeiden yhteistyosaatio sr has long-term experience expertise and strong cooperation networks to other actors working with similar advocacy and donor activities nationally and internation ally. Siemenpuu-Kansalaisliikkeiden yhteistyosaatio sr will fund approximately 60 to 90 projects. The goal is among others to strengthen the environmental rights of more than 100 000 beneficiaries and to contribute to processes leading to the inclusion of at least an additional 220 000 hectares of land under conservation and sustainable use. Siemenpuu-Kansalaisliikkeiden yhteistyosaatio sr?s communications work in Finland supports reaching tgoals. The communications activities will contribute in Finland to an understanding of the value and importance of development cooperation and policy. Siemenpuu-Kansalaisliikkeiden yhteistyosaatio sr plans to reach at least 45 000 people through its communication
